Hello enigmacodes,

FYI the current policy is to recommend starting with heritrix 1.14.3, until 2.2 comes out.

enigmacodes wrote:
> Hi all,
> 
> I am new to heritrix. I wanted to run the crawler from the command-line.
> what are the options for running cmdline-jmxclient-0.10.5.jar?
> I have had a look at http://crawler.archive.org/cmdline-jmxclient/
> 
> java -jar cmdline-jmxclient.jar USER:PASS HOST:PORT [BEAN] [COMMAND]
> 
> Where can I find a list of [BEAN]'s available and the related command?
> I am using heritrix-2.0.0-dist.tar.gz.

There's some rudimentary info on using cmdline-jmxclient-0.10.5.jar here:
http://tech.groups.yahoo.com/group/archive-crawler/message/4994

> 
> I get the following error as I try to shutdown heritrix from the cmdline:
> ------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
> root@pk:/usr/local/Heritrix/heritrix-2.0.0/bin# java -jar cmdline-jmxclient-0.10.5.jar controlRole:admin localhost:8080 org.archive.crawler:jmxport=8849,name=Heritrix,type=CrawlService,guiport=8080,host=pk shutdown
> Exception in thread "main" java.io.IOException: Failed to retrieve RMIServer stub: javax.naming.CommunicationException [Root exception is java.rmi.ConnectIOException: non-JRMP server at remote endpoint]

You have specified port 8080, which is the web ui port. The jmx port is 8849 by default.

HTH,
Noah
